bibl.title: Letter from Cornelia Knox Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, November 15, 1952

div1.p: Kean encloses three letters for Hench to read.

div1.head: Letter from Cornelia Knox Kean to Philip Showalter Hench, November 15, 1952
div1.opener:
2804 N STREET, N. W.
GEORGETOWN
WASHINGTON 7, D. C.
15 November 1952
My dear Colonel Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you for your kind letter of
November 7th. I also received a letter
from Sr. CesaR Exposito, Secretary to
Dr. Alberto Recio. I am enclosing the
Correspondence. My reply I asked
General Love to Edit for me, as
General Kean used to do. I enclose his
letter referring to his Dictionary spells my
HEROS = HEROES. So I made
another copy.

With love to your sweet wife. God
Bless you both. You must be a
C2
B5
good boy, and listen to her!
